scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-413 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-413 is a star with 0.82 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 2764.29 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-413 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-413 system


Kepler-413 b

Kepler-413 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-413 b is 67.098 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-413 b is 4.347 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-413 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-413, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-413 - System With 1 Exoplanet
